solution_line_template: Each week she makes ${normal_hourly_rate} * {normal_hours_per_week} = $<<{normal_hourly_rate}*{normal_hours_per_week}={normal_weekly_earnings}>>{normal_weekly_earnings} from her normal hours.
For overtime she makes ${normal_hourly_rate} * {overtime_rate_multiplier} = $<<{normal_hourly_rate}*{overtime_rate_multiplier}={overtime_hourly_rate}>>{overtime_hourly_rate} per hour.
Each week she works {total_hours_per_week} - {normal_hours_per_week} = <<{total_hours_per_week}-{normal_hours_per_week}={overtime_hours_per_week}>>{overtime_hours_per_week} overtime hours per week.

She makes a total of {overtime_hours_per_week} * ${overtime_hourly_rate} = $<<{overtime_hours_per_week}*{overtime_hourly_rate}={overtime_weekly_earnings}>>{overtime_weekly_earnings} from overtime every week.

This means she makes a total of ${normal_weekly_earnings} + ${overtime_weekly_earnings} = $<<{normal_weekly_earnings}+{overtime_weekly_earnings}={total_weekly_earnings}>>{total_weekly_earnings} per week.
To reach ${car_cost} she would need to work ${car_cost} / ${total_weekly_earnings} = <<{car_cost}/{total_weekly_earnings}={weeks_to_work}>>{weeks_to_work} weeks.
